text: {{Infobox writer | name = Diana Kennedy | honorific_prefix = | honorific_suffix = MBE | image = Diana Kennedy 2016.jpg | caption = Kennedy in 2016 | birth_name = Diana Southwood | birth_date = | birth_place = Loughton, Essex, England | death_date = | death_place = Zitácuaro, Michoacán, Mexico | occupation = Author, researcher and cook | genre = Cookbooks | subject = Mexican cuisine | spouse = | awards = Order of the Aztec Eagle, Order of the British Empire | years_active = 1967–2022 | website = }} Diana Kennedy MBE (; 3 March 1923 – 24 July 2022) was a British food writer. She was known for writing English-language books about Mexican cuisine. Her best known book was The Cuisines of Mexico. Kennedy was honored with the Order of the Aztec Eagle from the Mexican government, and was appointed a Member of the Order of the British Empire. Kennedy died on 24 July 2022 at her home in Zitácuaro, Mexico at the age of 99. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Food writers Category:Writers from Essex
title: Diana Kennedy
